authorization Module¶

The authorization module contains a class of the same name to handle simple authentication(login) and authorization(token)

Examples¶

Login and logout to an account¶

The following script shows how to login and logout.

import synspot

# login
synspot.userLogin('xie1', 'Xie1@123')

# logout
synspot.userLogout()

Note

The authorization class has several methods, but they are all marked as “experimental.” Read that as you will. The [source] link is there for a reason.

Warning

This method is experimental.

Classes¶

class synspot.authorization.Authorization[source]¶
userLogin(username: str, password: str)[source]¶

Get Token through HTTP authorization’s Basic Auth when first time login. Update __token in Network class

Parameters

  • username – The username of current user

  • password – The password of current user

Returns

Boolean

Raises

OSError – Placeholder.

userLogout()[source]¶

Handle user logout by deleting the information in the instances of Network, PI, and Database_class.

Returns

None

Raises

OSError – Placeholder.
